using System;
using System.Collections.Generic;
using Data.Grades;
using Data.Saves;
using Managers;
using Tools;
using UnityEngine;
using UnityEngine.SceneManagement;

namespace GameSetup
{
 public class GameManager : StaticBehaviour<GameManager>
 {
 [SerializeField] private SaveData _saveData;
 [SerializeField] private GradeStaticData _gradeStaticData;

 private readonly Dictionary<Type, object> _globalContainer = new();
 private readonly Dictionary<Type, object> _sceneContainer = new();

 protected override void OnAwake()
 {
 var saveManager = new SaveManager(_saveData);
 var currencyManager = new CurrencyManager(_saveData.CurrencySaveData);
 var gradeManager = new GradeManager(_saveData.GradeSaveData, _gradeStaticData, currencyManager, saveManager);

 AddGlobal(saveManager);
 AddGlobal(currencyManager);
 AddGlobal(gradeManager);

 DontDestroyOnLoad(gameObject);
 }

 public static T Get<T>() where T : class
 {
 if (Instance._globalContainer.TryGetValue(typeof(T), out var instance))
 return (T) instance;

 if (Instance._sceneContainer.TryGetValue(typeof(T), out instance))
 return (T) instance;

 throw new Exception($"Type {typeof(T)} not registered in GameManager.");
 }

 public static void Add<T>(T instance) where T : class
 {
 var type = typeof(T);
 if (instance == null)
 throw new ArgumentNullException(nameof(instance), $"Trying to register null instance of {typeof(T)}");

 if (Instance._sceneContainer.ContainsKey(type))
 Debug.LogWarning($"Scene container already has {type}. Overwriting.");

 Instance._sceneContainer[type] = instance;
 }
 
 public static void ClearSceneContainer()
 {
 if (Instance == null)
 return;

 Instance._sceneContainer.Clear();
 }

 private void AddGlobal<T>(T instance) where T : class
 {
 _globalContainer[typeof(T)] = instance;
 }
 }
}

using UnityEngine;

namespace Tools
{
 public class StaticBehaviour<T> : MonoBehaviour where T : Component
 {
 private static T _instance;

 protected static T Instance
 {
 get
 {
 if (_instance)
 return _instance;

 _instance = FindFirstObjectByType<T>();
 if (_instance)
 {
 return _instance;
 }

 throw new System.Exception($"Instance of {typeof(T)} not found in scene. Ensure it is added to the scene");
 }
 }

 private void Awake()
 {
 if (_instance != null && _instance != this)
 {
 Destroy(gameObject);
 return;
 }
 
 if (_instance == null)
 {
 _instance = this as T;
 }

 OnAwake();
 }

 private void OnDestroy()
 {
 if (_instance == this)
 {
 _instance = null;
 }
 }

 protected virtual void OnAwake()
 {
 }
 }
}

using System;
using System.Collections.Generic;
using UnityEngine;

namespace State_System
{
 /// <summary>
 /// This is an implementation of a finite state machine (FSM) in Unity using generics, where the state machine can be used for any type of Enum.
 /// The AbstractStateMachine class has a generic type T that is constrained to be an Enum type. It inherits from the MonoBehaviour class, 
 /// which allows it to be added to a game object and participate in the Unity event system.
 /// </summary>
 /// <typeparam name="T"></typeparam>
 public class AbstractStateMachine<T> : MonoBehaviour, IStateMachine where T : System.Enum
 {
 /// <summary>
 /// The startState variable is a field of type T and it represents the initial state of the state machine. 
 /// It is marked as SerializeField so that it can be set in the Unity Inspector.
 /// </summary>
 [SerializeField] protected T startState;

 /// <summary>
 /// The states variable is a dictionary that maps states to StateCase objects. 
 /// A StateCase object contains a state variable of type EnemyStateBehavior (an interface for defining enemy states) and a list of transitions, 
 /// each of which is a StateTransition<T> object. The StateTransition class defines the criteria for transitioning between states.
 /// </summary>
 protected Dictionary<T, StateCase> states = new Dictionary<T, StateCase>();

 /// <summary>
 /// The CurrentState property is a getter/setter that tracks the current state of the state machine.
 /// </summary>
 public T CurrentState { get; protected set; }

 /// <summary>
 /// The IsPlaying property is a boolean flag that is used to start and stop the state machine.
 /// </summary>
 public bool IsPlaying { get; protected set; }

 /// <summary>
 /// The StartMachine method initializes the state machine by setting IsPlaying to true, setting the CurrentState to the startState, and calling the StartState method.
 /// </summary>
 public void StartMachine()
 {
 IsPlaying = true;

 CurrentState = startState;
 StartState();
 }

 public void TryStartMachine()
 {
 if (states.Count == 0)
 {
 Init();
 return;
 }
 
 StartMachine();
 }
 
 protected virtual void Init() { }

 /// <summary>
 /// The StartState method retrieves the EnemyStateBehavior for the current state, subscribes to the OnFinished event of the state, and calls the OnStart method of the state.
 /// </summary>
 private void StartState()
 {
 var state = states[CurrentState].state;

 state.SubscribeOnFinish(OnStateFinished);
 state.OnStart();
 }

 /// <summary>
 /// The EndState method retrieves the EnemyStateBehavior for the current state, unsubscribes from the OnFinished event of the state, and calls the OnEnd method of the state.
 /// </summary>
 private void EndState()
 {
 var state = states[CurrentState].state;

 state.UnsubscribeFromFinish(OnStateFinished);
 state.OnEnd();
 }

 /// <summary>
 /// The StopMachine method sets IsPlaying to false and calls the OnEnd method of the current state.
 /// </summary>
 public void StopMachine()
 {
 IsPlaying = false;

 EndState();
 }

 /// <summary>
 /// The OnStateFinished method is called when the OnFinished event is triggered by the current state. 
 /// It retrieves the StateCase for the current state and iterates through its transitions. 
 /// If a transition's transitionType is set to StateTransitionType.OnFinish and it evaluates to true (i.e. the criteria for the transition are met), 
 /// the EndState method is called, the CurrentState is updated to the next state, and the StartState method is called.
 /// </summary>
 private void OnStateFinished()
 {
 var stateCase = states[CurrentState];

 var state = stateCase.state;
 var transitions = stateCase.transitions;

 for (int i = 0; i < transitions.Count; i++)
 {
 var transition = transitions[i];
 if (transition.transitionType == StateTransitionType.OnFinish && transition.Evaluate(out var nextState))
 {
 EndState();

 CurrentState = nextState;

 StartState();
 break;
 }
 }
 }

 /// <summary>
 /// The Update method is called once per frame when the state machine is playing. 
 /// It retrieves the StateCase for the current state, calls the OnUpdate method of the state, and iterates through its transitions. 
 /// If a transition's transitionType is set to StateTransitionType.
 /// Independent and it evaluates to true, the EndState method is called, the CurrentState is updated to the next state, and the StartState method is called.
 /// </summary>
 private void Update()
 {
 if (IsPlaying)
 {
 var stateCase = states[CurrentState];

 var state = stateCase.state;
 var transitions = stateCase.transitions;

 state.OnUpdate();

 for (int i = 0; i < transitions.Count; i++)
 {
 var transition = transitions[i];
 if (transition.transitionType == StateTransitionType.Independent && transition.Evaluate(out var nextState))
 {
 EndState();

 CurrentState = nextState;

 StartState();
 break;
 }
 }
 }
 }

 public Enum GetCurentState() => CurrentState;

 /// <summary>
 /// The StateCase class is a simple container for a EnemyStateBehavior and its list of StateTransition<T> objects.
 /// </summary>
 public class StateCase
 {
 public IStateBehavior state;
 public List<StateTransition<T>> transitions;
 }
 }

 public interface IStateMachine
 {
 void StartMachine();
 void StopMachine();
 Enum GetCurentState();
 }
}

using System.Collections.Generic;
using Cysharp.Threading.Tasks;
using UnityEngine;

namespace UniversalPool
{
 public class BasePool<T> : IClearAble where T : Component
 {
 private int _maxCount;

 private Queue<GameObject> _pool;
 private List<GameObject> _inGame;
 private Dictionary<GameObject, ComponentBehaviour<T>> _components = new();

 private Transform _transform;

 public BasePool(T prefab, int initialCount, int maxCount = 0, Transform transform = null)
 {
 _transform = transform;

 _maxCount = maxCount;

 _pool = new();
 _inGame = new();
 CreatePool(initialCount, prefab, transform);
 }

 public void Clear()
 {
 foreach (var gameObject in _inGame)
 {
 if (_components.TryGetValue(gameObject, out var tBehaviour))
 tBehaviour.Behaviour.EventDisabled -= OnInstanceDisabled;
 }

 _pool.Clear();
 _inGame.Clear();
 _components.Clear();

 _transform = null;
 }

 public bool TryGetInstance(out T instance, T key, Vector3 position, Vector3? forward = null,
 Transform parent = null)
 {
 if (!key)
 {
 Debug.LogError("Cannot create object with null key/prefab");
 instance = null;
 return false;
 }

 GameObject gameObject = null;

 CheckHideFirstOne();

 if (_pool.Count == 0)
 {
 gameObject = CreateObject(key, position, forward, parent);
 }
 else
 {
 gameObject = _pool.Dequeue();

 if (!gameObject)
 {
 gameObject = CreateObject(key, position, forward, parent);
 }
 else
 {
 gameObject.transform.position = position;

 if (forward != null)
 gameObject.transform.forward = forward.Value;

 gameObject.transform.SetParent(parent);
 }
 }

 if (!gameObject)
 {
 instance = null;
 return false;
 }

 _inGame.Add(gameObject);

 var tbehaviour = _components[gameObject];
 instance = tbehaviour.Component;
 var behaviour = tbehaviour.Behaviour;

 behaviour.EventDisabled += OnInstanceDisabled;

 gameObject.SetActive(true);
 return true;
 }

 private void CreatePool(int count, T prefab, Transform parent)
 {
 for (int i = 0; i < count; i++)
 {
 var instance = CreateObject(prefab, Vector3.zero, null, parent);
 instance.SetActive(false);
 _pool.Enqueue(instance);
 }
 }

 private GameObject CreateObject(T key, Vector3 position, Vector3? forward = null, Transform parent = null)
 {
 if (!key)
 {
 Debug.LogError("Cannot create object with null key/prefab");
 return null;
 }

 var pooledObject = Object.Instantiate(key, position, key.transform.rotation, parent);

 if (forward != null)
 pooledObject.transform.forward = forward.Value;

 _components.Add(pooledObject.gameObject, new ComponentBehaviour<T>()
 {
 Component = pooledObject,
 Behaviour = CreateOrGetComponent<PooledBehaviour>(pooledObject.gameObject)
 });

 return pooledObject.gameObject;
 }

 private void OnInstanceDisabled(PooledBehaviour behaviour)
 {
 if (!behaviour)
 return;

 behaviour.EventDisabled -= OnInstanceDisabled;

 ReturnToPool(behaviour.gameObject).Forget();
 }

 private async UniTaskVoid ReturnToPool(GameObject instance)
 {
 if (!instance)
 return;

 _pool.Enqueue(instance);
 _inGame.Remove(instance);

 await UniTask.Yield();

 if (!instance)
 return;

 instance.transform.SetParent(_transform);
 instance.SetActive(false);
 }

 private void CheckHideFirstOne()
 {
 if (_maxCount <= 0 || _inGame == null || _inGame.Count < _maxCount || _inGame.Count == 0)
 return;

 var lastInstance = _inGame[0];
 if (lastInstance)
 lastInstance.gameObject.SetActive(false);
 }

 private TM CreateOrGetComponent<TM>(GameObject instance) where TM : Component
 {
 if (!instance)
 {
 Debug.LogError("Cannot add component to null GameObject");
 return null;
 }

 var component = instance.GetComponent<TM>();
 if (!component)
 {
 component = instance.AddComponent<TM>();
 }

 return component;
 }
 }
}

using System;
using System.Collections.Generic;
using System.Linq;
using UnityEngine;
using Random = UnityEngine.Random;

namespace QuestSystem
{
 public class QuestsManager : MonoBehaviour
 {
 public Action<Quest> OnDataUpdate;

 [SerializeField] private QuestsSaves _saves;
 [SerializeField] private QuestsStaticData _questsStaticData;
 
 private List<QuestId> _currentQuests => _saves.CurrentQuests;
 private List<QuestId> _finishedQuests => _saves.FinishedQuests;
 public IEnumerable<Quest> CurrentQuests => AllQuests.Where(quest => _currentQuests.Contains(quest.Id));
 public IEnumerable<Quest> AllQuests => _questsStaticData.Quests.Values;

 public List<QuestId> NewCompletedQuests =>
 AllQuests.Where(quest => quest.IsCompleted && quest.IsPrizeTaken == false)
 .Select(quest => quest.Id)
 .ToList();

 public List<Quest> CompletedCurrentQuests =>
 CurrentQuests.Where(quest => quest.IsCompleted)
 .ToList();

 private void Awake()
 {
 InitStaticData();
 
 AddCurrentQuestsListeners();
 RemoveFinishedQuests();
 }

 private void OnDestroy()
 {
 var currentQuests = CurrentQuests.ToList();
 foreach (var quest in currentQuests) 
 RemoveQuestListeners(quest);
 }

 public void RemoveFinishedQuests()
 {
 var questsToRemove = AllQuests
 .Where(quest => quest.IsNeedToReset)
 .ToList();

 foreach (var quest in questsToRemove) 
 RemoveQuestListeners(quest);
 
 //ResetQuests(questsToRemove);

 var lastQuests = questsToRemove.Select(quest => quest.Id)
 .ToList();
 
 foreach (var quest in lastQuests)
 {
 if (_saves.FinishedQuests.Contains(quest) == false)
 _saves.FinishedQuests.Add(quest);
 }
 
 _currentQuests.RemoveAll(lastQuests.Contains);

 UpdateQuests();
 }
 
 private void AddCurrentQuestsListeners()
 {
 var currentQuests = CurrentQuests.ToList();
 foreach (var quest in currentQuests) 
 AddQuestListeners(quest);
 }

 private void UpdateQuests()
 {
 var currentQuests = CurrentQuests.ToList();
 var notCompletedQuestsCount = CurrentQuests.Count(quest => quest.IsCompleted == false);
 
 var addCount = _questsStaticData.MaxQuestsCount - notCompletedQuestsCount;
 if (addCount <= 0)
 return;
 
 var questsToAdd = AllQuests
 .Where(quest => _finishedQuests.Contains(quest.Id) == false && quest.IsNeedToReset == false && currentQuests.Contains(quest) == false)
 .ToList();

 if (questsToAdd.Count < addCount)
 {
 var toReset = AllQuests.Where(quest => quest.IsNeedToReset).ToList();
 ResetQuests(toReset);
 _finishedQuests.Clear();
 
 questsToAdd = AllQuests
 .Where(quest => _finishedQuests.Contains(quest.Id) == false && quest.IsNeedToReset == false && currentQuests.Contains(quest) == false)
 .ToList();
 }
 
 questsToAdd = questsToAdd
 .OrderBy(quest =>
 {
 var index = _questsStaticData.QuestsOrder.IndexOf(quest.Id);
 return index == -1 ? _questsStaticData.QuestsOrder.Count + Random.Range(1,1000000) : index;
 })
 .Take(addCount)
 .ToList();
 
 foreach (var quest in questsToAdd) 
 AddQuestListeners(quest);

 _currentQuests.AddRange(questsToAdd.Select(quest => quest.Id));
 }

 private void AddQuestListeners(Quest quest)
 {
 quest.EventQuestUpdated += OnQuestUpdated;
 quest.AddListener();
 }

 private void RemoveQuestListeners(Quest quest)
 {
 quest.EventQuestUpdated -= OnQuestUpdated;
 quest.RemoveListener();
 }

 private void InitStaticData()
 {
 foreach (var (questId, quest) in _questsStaticData.Quests) 
 quest.Init(GetSave(questId), questId, _questsStaticData);
 }
 
 private void ResetQuests(List<Quest> quests)
 {
 foreach (var quest in quests) 
 quest.Reset();
 }

 private void OnQuestUpdated(Quest quest)
 {
 var data = quest.SaveData;
 
 data.Count = quest.Count;

 if (quest.IsCompleted || quest.IsPrizeTaken || quest.IsNeedToReset)
 {
 RemoveFinishedQuests();
 Save();
 }

 OnDataUpdate?.Invoke(quest);
 }
 
 private void Save()
 {
 _saves.Save();
 }
 
 private QuestSaveData GetSave(QuestId id) =>
 _saves.GetSave(id);
 
 private Quest GetQuest(QuestId id) =>
 _questsStaticData.GetQuest(id);

 }
}

using System;
using System.Collections.Generic;

namespace EventsManager
{
 public class GameEvent
 {
 }

 // A simple Event System that can be used for remote systems communication
 public static class EventManager
 {
 static readonly Dictionary<Type, Action<GameEvent>> s_Events = new Dictionary<Type, Action<GameEvent>>();

 static readonly Dictionary<Delegate, Action<GameEvent>> s_EventLookups =
 new Dictionary<Delegate, Action<GameEvent>>();

 public static void AddListener<T>(Action<T> evt) where T : GameEvent
 {
 if (!s_EventLookups.ContainsKey(evt))
 {
 Action<GameEvent> newAction = (e) => evt((T) e);
 s_EventLookups[evt] = newAction;

 if (s_Events.TryGetValue(typeof(T), out Action<GameEvent> internalAction))
 s_Events[typeof(T)] = internalAction += newAction;
 else
 s_Events[typeof(T)] = newAction;
 }
 }

 public static void RemoveListener<T>(Action<T> evt) where T : GameEvent
 {
 if (s_EventLookups.TryGetValue(evt, out var action))
 {
 if (s_Events.TryGetValue(typeof(T), out var tempAction))
 {
 tempAction -= action;
 if (tempAction == null)
 s_Events.Remove(typeof(T));
 else
 s_Events[typeof(T)] = tempAction;
 }

 s_EventLookups.Remove(evt);
 }
 }

 public static void Broadcast(GameEvent evt)
 {
 if (s_Events.TryGetValue(evt.GetType(), out var action))
 action.Invoke(evt);
 }

 public static void Clear()
 {
 s_Events.Clear();
 s_EventLookups.Clear();
 }
 }
}

using System;
using InputManager;
using UnityEngine;
using UnityEngine.AI;

namespace Core.Character
{
 public class PlayerMovement : MonoBehaviour
 {
 private static readonly int SpeedHash = Animator.StringToHash("Speed");
 [SerializeField] private InputController _inputController;
 [SerializeField] private NavMeshAgent _agent;
 [SerializeField] private Animator _animator;
 [SerializeField] private float _rotationSpeed = 10f;
 
 private Vector3 _moveDirection;
 private Vector3 _prevPosition;
 private Camera _mainCamera;

 private void Awake()
 {
 _mainCamera = Camera.main;
 _prevPosition = transform.position;
 }

 private void Update()
 {
 DoMovement();
 }

 private void FixedUpdate()
 {
 MoveThePlayer(_moveDirection);
 }

 private Vector3 ToMainHeroDirection()
 {
 var cameraForward = _mainCamera.transform.forward;
 var cameraRight = _mainCamera.transform.right;

 cameraForward.y = 0f;
 cameraRight.y = 0f;

 return cameraForward.normalized * _inputController.Move.y + cameraRight.normalized * _inputController.Move.x;
 }

 private void MoveThePlayer(Vector3 desiredDirection)
 {
 Vector3 movement = new Vector3(desiredDirection.x, 0f, desiredDirection.z);
 movement = movement.normalized * (_agent.speed * Time.fixedDeltaTime);

 _agent.Move(movement);
 }

 private void DoMovement()
 {
 _moveDirection = ToMainHeroDirection();

 var speed = GetSpeedByFrame();
 var magnitude = speed.magnitude;

 AnimateCharacter(magnitude);

 if (magnitude < 0.01f)
 return;
 
 var direction = new Vector3(speed.x, 0f, speed.z);
 transform.forward = Vector3.RotateTowards(transform.forward, direction, _rotationSpeed * Time.deltaTime, 0f);
 }


 private void AnimateCharacter(float speedMagnitude)
 {
 _animator.SetFloat(SpeedHash, speedMagnitude / Time.deltaTime, 0.3f, Time.deltaTime);
 }

 private Vector3 GetSpeedByFrame()
 {
 var speed = transform.position - _prevPosition;
 _prevPosition = transform.position;
 return speed;
 }
 }
}

Dependency Injection Container Pattern\nThe project implements a custom dependency injection system through the `GameManager` class:\n\n```csharp\npublic class GameManager : StaticBehaviour<GameManager>\n{\n private readonly Dictionary<Type, object> _globalContainer = new();\n private readonly Dictionary<Type, object> _sceneContainer = new();\n \n public static T Get<T>() where T : class\n public static void Add<T>(T instance) where T : class\n}\n```\n\n**Key Features:**\n- Global container for persistent services (SaveManager, CurrencyManager, GradeManager)\n- Scene-specific container for temporary dependencies\n- Automatic scene cleanup on level transitions\n- Type-safe dependency resolution\n\n### 2. Singleton Pattern with StaticBehaviour\nCustom singleton implementation ensuring single instance per scene:\n\n```csharp\npublic class StaticBehaviour<T> : MonoBehaviour where T : Component\n{\n protected static T Instance { get; }\n // Automatic instance management with safety checks\n}\n```\n\n**Benefits:**\n- Unity lifecycle integration\n- Automatic cleanup on scene changes\n- Exception handling for missing instances\n- Generic implementation for any MonoBehaviour\n\n### 3. Finite State Machine (FSM) System\nRobust generic state machine implementation:\n\n```csharp\npublic class AbstractStateMachine<T> : MonoBehaviour, IStateMachine where T : System.Enum\n{\n protected Dictionary<T, StateCase> states = new Dictionary<T, StateCase>();\n // Support for transition types: OnFinish, Independent\n}\n```\n\n**Features:**\n- Generic enum-based states\n- Event-driven state transitions\n- Two transition types: OnFinish (triggered) and Independent (frame-based)\n- State behavior interface for consistent implementation\n\n### 4. Object Pool Pattern\nUniversal pooling system for performance optimization:\n\n```csharp\npublic class BasePool<T> : IClearAble where T : Component\n{\n private Queue<GameObject> _pool;\n private List<GameObject> _inGame;\n // Automatic instance management and memory optimization\n}\n```\n\n**Features:**\n- Generic component-based pooling\n- Maximum instance limits\n- Automatic cleanup with UniTask\n- Memory leak prevention\n- Parent transform management\n\n### 5. Event System\nDecoupled communication system using type-safe events:\n\n```csharp\npublic static class EventManager\n{\n public static void AddListener<T>(Action<T> evt) where T : GameEvent\n public static void RemoveListener<T>(Action<T> evt) where T : GameEvent\n public static void Broadcast(GameEvent evt)\n```\n\n**Benefits:**\n- Type-safe event handling\n- Automatic subscription management\n- Decoupled system communication\n- Memory leak prevention\n\n## Data Architecture\n\n### ScriptableObject-Based Data Management\nAll game data is managed through ScriptableObjects:\n\n- **SaveData.asset**: Persistent game state\n- **QuestsStaticData.asset**: Quest definitions and configurations\n- **GradeStaticData.asset**: Player progression data\n- **EffectsLibrary.asset**: Visual effects library\n\n### Save System\nCustom save system with ScriptableObject integration:\n\n```csharp\npublic class SaveableScriptableObject : ScriptableObject\n{\n // Automatic serialization and persistence\n}\n```\n\n**Features:**\n- Automatic data persistence\n- Version control friendly\n- Inspector integration\n- Runtime data modification\n\n## Core Systems\n\n### 1. # Unity Project Template - Technical Overview

## Project Information

- **Unity Version**: 6000.0.26f1 (Unity 6)
- **Rendering Pipeline**: Universal Render Pipeline (URP) 17.0.3
- **Architecture**: Component-based with custom architectural patterns
- **Project Type**: Game template with modular systems

## Core Architectural Patterns

### 1. Dependency Injection Container Pattern

The project implements a custom dependency injection system through the `GameManager` class:

```csharp
public class GameManager : StaticBehaviour<GameManager>
{
 private readonly Dictionary<Type, object> _globalContainer = new();
 private readonly Dictionary<Type, object> _sceneContainer = new();
 
 public static T Get<T>() where T : class
 public static void Add<T>(T instance) where T : class
}
```

**Key Features:**

- Global container for persistent services (SaveManager, CurrencyManager, GradeManager)
- Scene-specific container for temporary dependencies
- Automatic scene cleanup on level transitions
- Type-safe dependency resolution

### 2. Singleton Pattern with StaticBehaviour

Custom singleton implementation ensuring single instance per scene:

```csharp
public class StaticBehaviour<T> : MonoBehaviour where T : Component
{
 protected static T Instance { get; }
 // Automatic instance management with safety checks
}
```

**Benefits:**

- Unity lifecycle integration
- Automatic cleanup on scene changes
- Exception handling for missing instances
- Generic implementation for any MonoBehaviour

### 3. Finite State Machine (FSM) System

Robust generic state machine implementation:

```csharp
public class AbstractStateMachine<T> : MonoBehaviour, IStateMachine where T : System.Enum
{
 protected Dictionary<T, StateCase> states = new Dictionary<T, StateCase>();
 // Support for transition types: OnFinish, Independent
}
```

**Features:**

- Generic enum-based states
- Event-driven state transitions
- Two transition types: OnFinish (triggered) and Independent (frame-based)
- State behavior interface for consistent implementation

### 4. Object Pool Pattern

Universal pooling system for performance optimization:

```csharp
public class BasePool<T> : IClearAble where T : Component
{
 private Queue<GameObject> _pool;
 private List<GameObject> _inGame;
 // Automatic instance management and memory optimization
}
```

**Features:**

- Generic component-based pooling
- Maximum instance limits
- Automatic cleanup with UniTask
- Memory leak prevention
- Parent transform management

### 5. Event System

Decoupled communication system using type-safe events:

```csharp
public static class EventManager
{
 public static void AddListener<T>(Action<T> evt) where T : GameEvent
 public static void RemoveListener<T>(Action<T> evt) where T : GameEvent
 public static void Broadcast(GameEvent evt)
```

**Benefits:**

- Type-safe event handling
- Automatic subscription management
- Decoupled system communication
- Memory leak prevention

## Data Architecture

### ScriptableObject-Based Data Management

All game data is managed through ScriptableObjects:

- **SaveData.asset**: Persistent game state
- **QuestsStaticData.asset**: Quest definitions and configurations
- **GradeStaticData.asset**: Player progression data
- **EffectsLibrary.asset**: Visual effects library

### Save System

Custom save system with ScriptableObject integration:

```csharp
public class SaveableScriptableObject : ScriptableObject
{
 // Automatic serialization and persistence
}
```

**Features:**

- Automatic data persistence
- Version control friendly
- Inspector integration
- Runtime data modification

## Core Systems

### 1. Quest System

Comprehensive quest management with:

- **Quest Types**: Modular quest implementations
- **Difficulty Levels**: Configurable quest difficulty
- **Progress Tracking**: Real-time quest progress
- **Reward System**: Automated reward distribution
- **Save Integration**: Persistent quest states

### 2. Currency & Grade System

Player progression management:

- **Multiple Currencies**: Flexible currency types
- **Grade Progression**: Experience-based leveling
- **Automatic Persistence**: Save/load integration

### 3. Input Management

Flexible input handling:

- **InputController**: Centralized input processing
- **Multiple Input Types**: Touch, keyboard, controller support
- **ScriptableObject Configuration**: Customizable input settings

### 4. Effects Management

Centralized visual effects system:

- **Effect Pooling**: Performance-optimized effect spawning
- **Type-safe Effects**: Enum-based effect identification
- **Automatic Cleanup**: Memory management for effects

## Third-Party Integrations

### 1. UniTask (Cysharp)

Modern async/await support for Unity:

- **Performance**: Zero allocation async operations
- **Integration**: Seamless Unity lifecycle integration
- **Cancellation**: Proper cancellation token support

### 2. DOTween (Demigiant)

Professional tweening library:

- **Performance**: Optimized animation system
- **Rich API**: Comprehensive animation toolkit
- **Memory Efficient**: Pool-based allocation

### 3. Odin Inspector (Sirenix)

Advanced inspector enhancement:

- **Custom Drawers**: Rich editor experience
- **Validation**: Runtime validation tools
- **Serialization**: Enhanced serialization support

### 4. Joystick Pack

Mobile input solution:

- **Touch Controls**: Mobile-optimized input
- **Customizable**: Visual and functional customization

## Scene Architecture

### Scene Structure:

1. **Loading.unity**: Initial loading and setup scene
2. **MenuScene.unity**: Main menu and meta progression
3. **GameScene.unity**: Core gameplay with NavMesh integration

### Scene Management:

- **Persistent GameManager**: Survives scene transitions
- **Scene-specific Services**: Automatic registration/cleanup
- **Resource Management**: Efficient asset loading/unloading

## Development Patterns

### 1. Editor Tools

Custom editor utilities for improved workflow:

- **AutoInitializerLoader**: Automatic component setup
- **SaveReseter**: Development save management

### 2. Modular Design

Systems designed for reusability:

- **Generic Components**: Type-safe, reusable implementations
- **Interface-Based**: Flexible system integration
- **Pluggable Architecture**: Easy feature addition/removal

### 3. Performance Considerations

- **Object Pooling**: Reduced garbage collection
- **UniTask Integration**: Efficient async operations
- **Selective Updates**: Optimized update patterns
- **Memory Management**: Proper resource cleanup

## Code Quality Features

### 1. Error Handling

Comprehensive error management:

- Null reference protection
- Exception handling with meaningful messages
- Graceful degradation

### 2. Memory Management

- Automatic cleanup patterns
- IDisposable implementations
- Event unsubscription safety

### 3. Type Safety

- Generic constraints
- Interface-based design
- Compile-time error prevention

## Recommended Usage

This template is ideal for:

- **Mid-scale Unity projects** requiring robust architecture
- **Team development** with clear separation of concerns
- **Maintainable codebases** with modular design
- **Performance-critical applications** with optimized patterns
- **Cross-platform games** with flexible input handling

## Getting Started

1. **Scene Setup**: Start with MenuScene as entry point
2. **GameManager**: Automatic initialization of core systems
3. **Custom Systems**: Use provided patterns for new features
4. **Data Management**: Leverage ScriptableObject architecture
5. **Performance**: Utilize pooling and async patterns for optimization

This project demonstrates professional Unity development practices with emphasis on maintainability, performance, and
scalability.

using System;
using System.Collections.Generic;
using Data.Grades;
using Data.Saves;
using Managers;
using Tools;
using UnityEngine;
using UnityEngine.SceneManagement;

namespace GameSetup
{
 public class GameManager : StaticBehaviour<GameManager>
 {
 [SerializeField] private SaveData _saveData;
 [SerializeField] private GradeStaticData _gradeStaticData;

 private readonly Dictionary<Type, object> _globalContainer = new();
 private readonly Dictionary<Type, object> _sceneContainer = new();

 protected override void OnAwake()
 {
 var saveManager = new SaveManager(_saveData);
 var currencyManager = new CurrencyManager(_saveData.CurrencySaveData);
 var gradeManager = new GradeManager(_saveData.GradeSaveData, _gradeStaticData, currencyManager, saveManager);

 AddGlobal(saveManager);
 AddGlobal(currencyManager);
 AddGlobal(gradeManager);

 DontDestroyOnLoad(gameObject);
 }

 public static T Get<T>() where T : class
 {
 if (Instance._globalContainer.TryGetValue(typeof(T), out var instance))
 return (T) instance;

 if (Instance._sceneContainer.TryGetValue(typeof(T), out instance))
 return (T) instance;

 throw new Exception($"Type {typeof(T)} not registered in GameManager.");
 }

 public static void Add<T>(T instance) where T : class
 {
 var type = typeof(T);
 if (instance == null)
 throw new ArgumentNullException(nameof(instance), $"Trying to register null instance of {typeof(T)}");

 if (Instance._sceneContainer.ContainsKey(type))
 Debug.LogWarning($"Scene container already has {type}. Overwriting.");

 Instance._sceneContainer[type] = instance;
 }
 
 public static void ClearSceneContainer()
 {
 if (Instance == null)
 return;

 Instance._sceneContainer.Clear();
 }

 private void AddGlobal<T>(T instance) where T : class
 {
 _globalContainer[typeof(T)] = instance;
 }
 }
}

using UnityEngine;

namespace Tools
{
 public class StaticBehaviour<T> : MonoBehaviour where T : Component
 {
 private static T _instance;

 protected static T Instance
 {
 get
 {
 if (_instance)
 return _instance;

 _instance = FindFirstObjectByType<T>();
 if (_instance)
 {
 return _instance;
 }

 Debug.LogError($"StaticBehaviour: Instance of {typeof(T)} not found in the scene. Ensure it is added to a GameObject.");
 return null;
 }
 }

 private void Awake()
 {
 if (_instance != null && _instance != this)
 {
 Destroy(gameObject);
 return;
 }
 
 if (_instance == null)
 {
 _instance = this as T;
 }

 OnAwake();
 }

 private void OnDestroy()
 {
 if (_instance == this)
 {
 _instance = null;
 }
 }

 protected virtual void OnAwake()
 {
 }
 }
}

using System;
using System.Collections.Generic;
using UnityEngine;

namespace State_System
{
 /// <summary>
 /// This is an implementation of a finite state machine (FSM) in Unity using generics, where the state machine can be used for any type of Enum.
 /// The AbstractStateMachine class has a generic type T that is constrained to be an Enum type. It inherits from the MonoBehaviour class, 
 /// which allows it to be added to a game object and participate in the Unity event system.
 /// </summary>
 /// <typeparam name="T"></typeparam>
 public class AbstractStateMachine<T> : MonoBehaviour, IStateMachine where T : System.Enum
 {
 /// <summary>
 /// The startState variable is a field of type T and it represents the initial state of the state machine. 
 /// It is marked as SerializeField so that it can be set in the Unity Inspector.
 /// </summary>
 [SerializeField] protected T startState;

 /// <summary>
 /// The states variable is a dictionary that maps states to StateCase objects. 
 /// A StateCase object contains a state variable of type EnemyStateBehavior (an interface for defining enemy states) and a list of transitions, 
 /// each of which is a StateTransition<T> object. The StateTransition class defines the criteria for transitioning between states.
 /// </summary>
 protected Dictionary<T, StateCase> states = new Dictionary<T, StateCase>();

 /// <summary>
 /// The CurrentState property is a getter/setter that tracks the current state of the state machine.
 /// </summary>
 public T CurrentState { get; protected set; }

 /// <summary>
 /// The IsPlaying property is a boolean flag that is used to start and stop the state machine.
 /// </summary>
 public bool IsPlaying { get; protected set; }

 /// <summary>
 /// The StartMachine method initializes the state machine by setting IsPlaying to true, setting the CurrentState to the startState, and calling the StartState method.
 /// </summary>
 public void StartMachine()
 {
 IsPlaying = true;

 CurrentState = startState;
 StartState();
 }

 public void TryStartMachine()
 {
 if (states.Count == 0)
 {
 Init();
 return;
 }
 
 StartMachine();
 }
 
 protected virtual void Init() { }

 /// <summary>
 /// The StartState method retrieves the EnemyStateBehavior for the current state, subscribes to the OnFinished event of the state, and calls the OnStart method of the state.
 /// </summary>
 private void StartState()
 {
 var state = states[CurrentState].state;

 state.SubscribeOnFinish(OnStateFinished);
 state.OnStart();
 }

 /// <summary>
 /// The EndState method retrieves the EnemyStateBehavior for the current state, unsubscribes from the OnFinished event of the state, and calls the OnEnd method of the state.
 /// </summary>
 private void EndState()
 {
 var state = states[CurrentState].state;

 state.UnsubscribeFromFinish(OnStateFinished);
 state.OnEnd();
 }

 /// <summary>
 /// The StopMachine method sets IsPlaying to false and calls the OnEnd method of the current state.
 /// </summary>
 public void StopMachine()
 {
 IsPlaying = false;

 EndState();
 }

 /// <summary>
 /// The OnStateFinished method is called when the OnFinished event is triggered by the current state. 
 /// It retrieves the StateCase for the current state and iterates through its transitions. 
 /// If a transition's transitionType is set to StateTransitionType.OnFinish and it evaluates to true (i.e. the criteria for the transition are met), 
 /// the EndState method is called, the CurrentState is updated to the next state, and the StartState method is called.
 /// </summary>
 private void OnStateFinished()
 {
 var stateCase = states[CurrentState];

 var state = stateCase.state;
 var transitions = stateCase.transitions;

 for (int i = 0; i < transitions.Count; i++)
 {
 var transition = transitions[i];
 if (transition.transitionType == StateTransitionType.OnFinish && transition.Evaluate(out var nextState))
 {
 EndState();

 CurrentState = nextState;

 StartState();
 break;
 }
 }
 }

 /// <summary>
 /// The Update method is called once per frame when the state machine is playing. 
 /// It retrieves the StateCase for the current state, calls the OnUpdate method of the state, and iterates through its transitions. 
 /// If a transition's transitionType is set to StateTransitionType.
 /// Independent and it evaluates to true, the EndState method is called, the CurrentState is updated to the next state, and the StartState method is called.
 /// </summary>
 private void Update()
 {
 if (IsPlaying)
 {
 var stateCase = states[CurrentState];

 var state = stateCase.state;
 var transitions = stateCase.transitions;

 state.OnUpdate();

 for (int i = 0; i < transitions.Count; i++)
 {
 var transition = transitions[i];
 if (transition.transitionType == StateTransitionType.Independent && transition.Evaluate(out var nextState))
 {
 EndState();

 CurrentState = nextState;

 StartState();
 break;
 }
 }
 }
 }

 public Enum GetCurentState() => CurrentState;

 /// <summary>
 /// The StateCase class is a simple container for a EnemyStateBehavior and its list of StateTransition<T> objects.
 /// </summary>
 public class StateCase
 {
 public IStateBehavior state;
 public List<StateTransition<T>> transitions;
 }
 }

 public interface IStateMachine
 {
 void StartMachine();
 void StopMachine();
 Enum GetCurentState();
 }
}

using System.Collections.Generic;
using Cysharp.Threading.Tasks;
using UnityEngine;

namespace UniversalPool
{
 public class BasePool<T> : IClearAble where T : Component
 {
 private int _maxCount;

 private Queue<GameObject> _pool;
 private List<GameObject> _inGame;
 private Dictionary<GameObject, ComponentBehaviour<T>> _components = new();

 private Transform _transform;

 public BasePool(T prefab, int initialCount, int maxCount = 0, Transform transform = null)
 {
 _transform = transform;

 _maxCount = maxCount;

 _pool = new();
 _inGame = new();
 CreatePool(initialCount, prefab, transform);
 }

 public void Clear()
 {
 foreach (var gameObject in _inGame)
 {
 if (_components.TryGetValue(gameObject, out var tBehaviour))
 tBehaviour.Behaviour.EventDisabled -= OnInstanceDisabled;
 }

 _pool.Clear();
 _inGame.Clear();
 _components.Clear();

 _transform = null;
 }

 public bool TryGetInstance(out T instance, T key, Vector3 position, Vector3? forward = null,
 Transform parent = null)
 {
 if (!key)
 {
 Debug.LogError("Cannot create object with null key/prefab");
 instance = null;
 return false;
 }

 GameObject gameObject = null;

 CheckHideFirstOne();

 if (_pool.Count == 0)
 {
 gameObject = CreateObject(key, position, forward, parent);
 }
 else
 {
 gameObject = _pool.Dequeue();

 if (!gameObject)
 {
 gameObject = CreateObject(key, position, forward, parent);
 }
 else
 {
 gameObject.transform.position = position;

 if (forward != null)
 gameObject.transform.forward = forward.Value;

 gameObject.transform.SetParent(parent);
 }
 }

 if (!gameObject)
 {
 instance = null;
 return false;
 }

 _inGame.Add(gameObject);

 var tbehaviour = _components[gameObject];
 instance = tbehaviour.Component;
 var behaviour = tbehaviour.Behaviour;

 behaviour.EventDisabled += OnInstanceDisabled;

 gameObject.SetActive(true);
 return true;
 }

 private void CreatePool(int count, T prefab, Transform parent)
 {
 for (int i = 0; i < count; i++)
 {
 var instance = CreateObject(prefab, Vector3.zero, null, parent);
 instance.SetActive(false);
 _pool.Enqueue(instance);
 }
 }

 private GameObject CreateObject(T key, Vector3 position, Vector3? forward = null, Transform parent = null)
 {
 if (!key)
 {
 Debug.LogError("Cannot create object with null key/prefab");
 return null;
 }

 var pooledObject = Object.Instantiate(key, position, key.transform.rotation, parent);

 if (forward != null)
 pooledObject.transform.forward = forward.Value;

 _components.Add(pooledObject.gameObject, new ComponentBehaviour<T>()
 {
 Component = pooledObject,
 Behaviour = CreateOrGetComponent<PooledBehaviour>(pooledObject.gameObject)
 });

 return pooledObject.gameObject;
 }

 private void OnInstanceDisabled(PooledBehaviour behaviour)
 {
 if (!behaviour)
 return;

 behaviour.EventDisabled -= OnInstanceDisabled;

 ReturnToPool(behaviour.gameObject).Forget();
 }

 private async UniTaskVoid ReturnToPool(GameObject instance)
 {
 if (!instance)
 return;

 _pool.Enqueue(instance);
 _inGame.Remove(instance);

 await UniTask.Yield();

 if (!instance)
 return;

 instance.transform.SetParent(_transform);
 instance.SetActive(false);
 }

 private void CheckHideFirstOne()
 {
 if (_maxCount <= 0 || _inGame == null || _inGame.Count < _maxCount || _inGame.Count == 0)
 return;

 var lastInstance = _inGame[0];
 if (lastInstance)
 lastInstance.gameObject.SetActive(false);
 }

 private TM CreateOrGetComponent<TM>(GameObject instance) where TM : Component
 {
 if (!instance)
 {
 Debug.LogError("Cannot add component to null GameObject");
 return null;
 }

 var component = instance.GetComponent<TM>();
 if (!component)
 {
 component = instance.AddComponent<TM>();
 }

 return component;
 }
 }
}

using System;
using System.Collections.Generic;

namespace EventsManager
{
 public class GameEvent
 {
 }

 // A simple Event System that can be used for remote systems communication
 public static class EventManager
 {
 static readonly Dictionary<Type, Action<GameEvent>> s_Events = new Dictionary<Type, Action<GameEvent>>();

 static readonly Dictionary<Delegate, Action<GameEvent>> s_EventLookups =
 new Dictionary<Delegate, Action<GameEvent>>();

 public static void AddListener<T>(Action<T> evt) where T : GameEvent
 {
 if (!s_EventLookups.ContainsKey(evt))
 {
 Action<GameEvent> newAction = (e) => evt((T) e);
 s_EventLookups[evt] = newAction;

 if (s_Events.TryGetValue(typeof(T), out Action<GameEvent> internalAction))
 s_Events[typeof(T)] = internalAction += newAction;
 else
 s_Events[typeof(T)] = newAction;
 }
 }

 public static void RemoveListener<T>(Action<T> evt) where T : GameEvent
 {
 if (s_EventLookups.TryGetValue(evt, out var action))
 {
 if (s_Events.TryGetValue(typeof(T), out var tempAction))
 {
 tempAction -= action;
 if (tempAction == null)
 s_Events.Remove(typeof(T));
 else
 s_Events[typeof(T)] = tempAction;
 }

 s_EventLookups.Remove(evt);
 }
 }

 public static void Broadcast(GameEvent evt)
 {
 if (s_Events.TryGetValue(evt.GetType(), out var action))
 action.Invoke(evt);
 }

 public static void Clear()
 {
 s_Events.Clear();
 s_EventLookups.Clear();
 }
 }
}

[file] Assets/SO/SaveData.asset.meta (189B, 8 lines) - Jun 04, 2025 03:57 PM"},{"role":"assistant","content":[{"type":"text","text":""}],"tool_calls":[{"id":"tooluse_80_LZheZTB-Df337cSl_RA","type":"function","function":{"name":"edit_file","arguments":"{"target_file": "Assets/ProjectOverview.txt", "instructions": "Перепишу файл кратко на русском языке", "code_edit": "# Unity Шаблон Проекта - Краткий обзор\n\n## Основная информация\n- **Unity**: 6000.0.26f1 (Unity 6)\n- **Рендер пайплайн**: URP 17.0.3\n- **Архитектура**: Компонентная с кастомными паттернами\n\n## Ключевые системы\n\n### 1. Dependency Injection (DI)\nЦентральная система через `GameManager`:\n- Глобальный контейнер для SaveManager, CurrencyManager, GradeManager\n- Локальный контейнер для временных зависимостей\n- Автоочистка при смене сцен\n\n### 2. Singleton Pattern\nКастомная реализация `StaticBehaviour<T>`:\n- Интеграция с Unity lifecycle\n- Автоматическая очистка\n- Безопасное управление инстансами\n\n### 3. using CurrencyManagement;
using GradeManagement;
using UnityEngine;
using UnityEngine.UI;
using VContainer;

namespace UI.GameplayUI
{
 public class GamePlayUI : MonoBehaviour
 {
 [SerializeField] private Button _addCoinsButton;
 [SerializeField] private Button _gradeButton;

 [Inject] private CurrencyManager _currencyManager;
 [Inject] private GradeManager _gradeManager;

 private void OnEnable()
 {
 _addCoinsButton.onClick.AddListener(OnAddCoinsButtonClicked);
 _gradeButton.onClick.AddListener(OnGradeButtonClicked);
 _currencyManager.EventDataChanged += OnCurrencyChanged;

 UpdateGradeButtonState();
 }

 private void OnDisable()
 {
 _addCoinsButton.onClick.RemoveListener(OnAddCoinsButtonClicked);
 _gradeButton.onClick.RemoveListener(OnGradeButtonClicked);

 _currencyManager.EventDataChanged -= OnCurrencyChanged;
 }

 private void OnCurrencyChanged(CurrencyEvent currencyEvent)
 {
 UpdateGradeButtonState();
 }

 private void UpdateGradeButtonState()
 {
 _gradeButton.interactable = _gradeManager.IsCanGrade();
 }

 private void OnGradeButtonClicked()
 {
 if (_gradeManager.IsCanGrade())
 {
 _gradeManager.Grade();
 }
 else
 {
 Debug.LogWarning("Cannot grade: either max level reached or not enough currency.");
 }
 }

 private void OnAddCoinsButtonClicked()
 {
 _currencyManager.AddCurrency(CurrencyId.SoftCurrency, 1);
 }
 }
}

using CurrencyManagement;
using GradeManagement;
using SaveManagement;
using UnityEngine;
using VContainer;
using VContainer.Unity;

namespace BootScope
{
 public class MainLifetimeScope : LifetimeScope
 {
 [SerializeField] private SaveData _saveData;
 [SerializeField] private GradeStaticData _gradeStaticData;

 protected override void Awake()
 {
 base.Awake();
 DontDestroyOnLoad(gameObject);
 }

 protected override void Configure(IContainerBuilder builder)
 {
 // Register SaveData as instance
 builder.RegisterInstance(_saveData);

 // Register GradeStaticData as instance
 builder.RegisterInstance(_gradeStaticData);

 // Register SaveManager as singleton
 builder.Register<SaveManager>(Lifetime.Singleton)
 .WithParameter(_saveData);

 // Register CurrencyManager as singleton
 builder.Register<CurrencyManager>(Lifetime.Singleton)
 .WithParameter(_saveData.CurrencySaveData);

 // Register GradeManager as singleton
 builder.Register<GradeManager>(Lifetime.Singleton)
 .WithParameter(_saveData.GradeSaveData)
 .WithParameter(_gradeStaticData)
 .WithParameter(resolver => resolver.Resolve<CurrencyManager>())
 .WithParameter(resolver => resolver.Resolve<SaveManager>());
 }

 }
}

 {
 [SerializeField] private GamePlayUI _gamePlayUI;
 [SerializeField] private InputSetter _inputSetter;
 [SerializeField] private GameObject _winMenu;
 [SerializeField] private GameObject _loseMenu;

 private void Start()
 {
 _gamePlayUI.gameObject.SetActive(false);
 _inputSetter.gameObject.SetActive(false);
 }
 

 private void OnGameFinished(bool isPlayerWin)
 {
 if (isPlayerWin)
 {
 _winMenu.SetActive(true);
 }
 else
 {
 _loseMenu.SetActive(true);
 }
 }
 

 }
}

1. **Переместил инициализацию из `OnEnable()` в `Start()`** - VContainer инжектирует зависимости после `OnEnable()`, но до `Start()`, поэтому в `Start()` зависимости уже будут доступны.

2. **Добавил интерфейс `IStartable`** - это гарантирует, что VContainer правильно обработает lifecycle компонента.

3. **Добавил null-проверки в `OnDisable()`** - для безопасной отписки от событий.

4. **Зарегистрировал `GamePlayUI` в `MainLifetimeScope`** - чтобы VContainer знал о необходимости инжектировать зависимости в этот компонент.

Теперь `_currencyManager` будет инициализирован до первого обращения к нему в методе `Start()`."}]}]}
